Job.Name: Facebook Ad Media Buyer
Job.Description:
This is a small project (3-5 hours a week) for handling Facebook Ad's. All the media and copy has been created - The talents job will be to optimize each week.
Ideally, the talent will have spent 250k, 2-3 years of experience, and has ran B2B ads, national campaigns with a higher spend of about 200-$1000 per day. The target market is dentists.
Looking to start now ongoing.
Rate range is $50-90.

Job.Name: Senior Digital Marketing Manager
Job.Description:
FULL JD ATTACHED - AMOUNT DETERMINED BY BEST FIT
This individual will assist in managing an internal team of contractors, communicating with external clients, developing campaign strategies, and implementing and managing campaigns. Please note that this is a contract role with the goal of eventually transitioning to a permanent full-time employee.
As a Senior Digital Marketing Manager, you will report directly to the founder and oversee developing, implementing, tracking, and optimizing clients digital marketing campaigns across a wide range of platforms. You should have a strong grasp of current marketing tools and strategies and be able to lead integrated digital marketing campaigns from concept to execution. Successful candidates will be problem solvers and detail-oriented, as well as fluent in analytics, ad serving technology, digital marketing, and reporting.
5+ years of experience in a digital marketing role, ideally at an agency, publisher, client, and/or marketing startup Preferred: 3+ years of B2B marketing experience, preferably at a SaaS company

Job.Name: Marketing Generalist - Landfall Data
Job.Description:
SMS & Email Marketer (15 hrs/week, 2-3 years experience) defines the SMS & email marketing strategy including A/B tests, segmentation & automation, copywriting, campaign ideation, email deliverability & list cleaning, tool selection, and reporting & analytics.
Someone who can do more of the task work left from what the Marketing strategist has to suggest.

Job.Name: Senior Full Stack Developer - Aim Data
Job.Description:
Team objective: working on building a multi-tenant (i.e., cloud) solution for our clients, that will allow them to administer key aspects of their enterprise.
Background: We've done a rudimentary POC, and have come up with sufficient business requirements to transition to developing a true MVP (alpha/beta release).
What we've decided:
React - UI components Redux - state management MongoDB - underlying database AWS architecture (standing and supporting environments, deployments, security, etc.)
What we need someone to help decide (e.g., require architecture chops):
Middle-tier (e.g. REST, GraphQL, other) DevOps practices (code review, source control, deployment, cutovers, post prod support, etc.)
Experiences required:
Strong UI/UX background - how to make a UI be user friendly Can help "build out and mentor the growth of the team" Basic level of PM skills (Waterfall or Agile) to ensure commitments are met Critical Thinking / Analyst mindset (can really drive sometimes nebulous business requirements into technical assets)
Misc.
Preferred that they are located Columbus, OH metro area St Petersburg, Florida metro area Open to a transition to "full-time"

Job.Name: Customer Success Manager for Saas SMB
Job.Description:
I need to find an expert in customer success/support for my SaaS business. My business serves a high volume of small to medium brick and mortar retailers. We are looking for someone who can manage the team, but can also jump in and do the work when necessary. They need to have experience with SMB's and who can be an effective communicator between sales and marketing.
The position is an awesome opportunity for someone who has 3-10 years of experience and wants to apply their skills to a growing startup.
The position will start at 20 hours per week and scale from there.

Job.Description:
This talent must be able to take creative direction and run with it.
Marketing Strategist (15-20 hrs/week, 7-10 years experience) helps select and define the strategies & tactics for each client, provides support in proposals, owns data analysis, manages conversion rate optimization, defines customer segmentation & testing framework, selects marketing technologies, and manages budgets across channels.
Paid Social Media Marketer (15 hrs/week, 2-3 years experience) responsible for implementing the paid social advertising strategy across channels such as Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, TikTok, Pinterest, Twitter, and Reddit; select the right channels, creatives, copy, run A/B tests, and monitor and measure improvement.
SEO Marketer (10 hrs/week, 2-3 years experience) manages the search engine optimization campaigns, performs research on the industry/domain, creates backlinks, identifies technical issues hindering SEO performance, and continually measures and monitors SEO performance for clients campaigns and our online domain-specific properties.
This is more of an expert role, needed ASAP. Rate is in the 100 dollar-120 range.

Job.Name: UX/UI Designer for eCommerce Projects
Job.Description:
**Amount is undefined. Whoever matches the talent profile best*
We are looking for a really good UX/UI Designer (possibly multiple) to work on a number of eCommerce website projects over the coming weeks.
We are really brand-heavy with beautiful design. Looking for best-in-class people. Working alongside a copywriter, creative director and would take wireframes, scopes of work to design a website.
UX - Need someone to be able to understand the brand, site map, how to organize information, and communicate information quickly. Not looking for a 4-6 week deep dive, but someone who can get in there and build mid-fidelity wireframes.
Ideally, we are looking for someone who can work 40 hours a week but are open to hiring more people if necessary.
Main thing for him is the portfolio, similar vibe and style. Ideally, they'd know Figma really really well.
Looking to bring them on ASAP. Realistically supporting as early as next week.

Job.Name: SEO Webmaster
Job.Description:
We are in need of a webmaster who can help us with a variety of different website issues. This will mainly be for up-keep as time goes on and the company grows, only needing about 5 hours a week.
Tasks will include fixing broken links, making sure pictures are showing up, that links to challenges are working, and going over old articles to update SEO to better rank on Google.
For this role we are seeking more of an expert and strategist who can make suggestions as well as do the work. Someone who can grow with the company but also has 3-5 years of experience. Someone with food-blogging is a plus.

Job.Name: Fitness App FRD + Build
Job.Description:
Creation of detailed Feature and Function Specifications. Development, Deployment and Testing of an MVP of the Fitness App.
Hours are estimated by Task and totaled for the Project Actual hours will be tracked, and reported on a regular cadence Actual hours will be billed on a regular cadence (typically every 2 weeks) Hours per Task and Project may be adjusted with approval/ notice NOTE: Some work may be completed by talent on set contracts (not hourly) Duration may be extended or shortened and total hours adjusted with approval/notice

Task.Name: 20501 Project Management
Task.Description: Plan, Track Budget, Manage Resources

Task.Name: 20501 Concept / Design Creation
Task.Description: Define detailed Feature and Function specifications and requirements

Task.Name: 20501 Development + Testing
Task.Description:
Build/Code and test an MVP of the Fitness App Utilizing the MVP Product Requirements Document as a guide, the following deliverables will be included in Development and Deployment: 1. RTC Real-time Communication a. Integration with RTC provider to provide connections between multiple parties b. Support for 1 to 1 and 1 to many sessions c. Support for mobile devices i. Student will be able to join a session from their phone or tablet d. Provider: Twilio Video or similar e. Session limitations (duration, qty) 2. Music Provider Integration a. Requires additional research for source integration. b. Allow Trainer to toggle music stream 3. Web App a. Public Trainer Profiles i. Unique Marketable URL ii. Sharable Actions iii. Visitor tracking iv. Displays Classes v. Displays Calendar View vi. User can Select Class to see Class Details b. Trainer Dashboard i. Ability to create classes ii. See stats iii. See upcoming classes iv. Start a class v. Ability to integrate limited email marketing/sending (to be defined) vi. Ability to push class details/marketing posts to Social (to be defined) vii. Ability to select a charity partner from an integrated dropdown (based on Pledge.io plugin) c. Booking workflow with Class Type Logic i. Class selection ii. Support for one-time class purchase (single purchase) iii. Support for unlimited classes by trainer (subscription) d. Schedule/Calendar/Availability management i. Ties in with Class creation, ability to see available times, set class times, durations, and calendar ii. Support for cancelation e. Support for rescheduling f. Student Account and dashboard i. Account management Manage payment information See order history ii. Upcoming classes iii. Ability to join an upcoming class iv. Subscription management Ability to cancel/modify their subscriptions g. Admin Dashboard i. Ability to see statistics ii. Ability to see active users iii. Ability to see active classes iv. Ability to join classes in a hidden mode (moderator style) v. Ability to manage teachers Onboard, cancel, message vi. Ability to manage system email templates 4. Payment Integration i. Checkout functionality for a user to purchase 5. Notification System i. Email (integration with SendGrid type of tool) ii. SMS (integration with Twilio type of tool) iii. Transactional messaging for all user actions and class status iv. Tokenized emails for joining a scheduled class v. Reminders vi. Ability to manage system settings 6. Testing and Deployment a. Internal Testing and QA b. UAT phase, testing with client 7. Code & Documentation a. Code Delivery to clients repo i. If Customer does not have a code repository, Assemble will assist in creating such on the Customer's behalf b. Deliver documentation to Customer upon project completion i. Includes technical spec documentation outlines technical details such as programming language, frameworks, libraries used, etc
Includes user guide that outlines how the application works. This is structured via screenshots and explanations of the various features and functions

Job.Name: Squarespace Website - Bradley Sinclair Music
Job.Description:
I will be wanting to sell some Merch on the site. I dont have any at the moment but i definitely want the option. It would be like tshirts, vinyls, hats, stuff that you would see at a bands Merch table.
I want it to be pretty simple, a home page, a music page (links to places to listen like Spotify, Apple Music, YouTube etc.) An event page where we can list your dates and shows and what not, a contact section for booking etc. and a store section for Merch. Also some little things like a place to sign up for the mailing list on the main page towards the bottom or something. Id also like the main page to be able to like add new things, so if Im releasing a new song that would be the first thing you see, or if i just out out a music video Id want that to be the main page for a period of time.
On those sites i like that they are simple and get the advertisement point across well. Of the three platforms i probably like the two square space ones best .

Task.Name: 20501 Development + Testing
Task.Description:
Build/Code and test an MVP of the Fitness App Utilizing the MVP Product Requirements Document as a guide, the following deliverables will be included in Development and Deployment: 1. RTC Real-time Communication a. Integration with RTC provider to provide connections between multiple parties b. Support for 1 to 1 and 1 to many sessions c. Support for mobile devices i. Student will be able to join a session from their phone or tablet d. Provider: Twilio Video or similar e. Session limitations (duration, qty) 2. Music Provider Integration a. Requires additional research for source integration. b. Allow Trainer to toggle music stream 3. Web App a. Public Trainer Profiles i. Unique Marketable URL ii. Sharable Actions iii. Visitor tracking iv. Displays Classes v. Displays Calendar View vi. User can Select Class to see Class Details b. Trainer Dashboard i. Ability to create classes ii. See stats iii. See upcoming classes iv. Start a class v. Ability to integrate limited email marketing/sending (to be defined) vi. Ability to push class details/marketing posts to Social (to be defined) vii. Ability to select a charity partner from an integrated dropdown (based on Pledge.io plugin) c. Booking workflow with Class Type Logic i. Class selection ii. Support for one-time class purchase (single purchase) iii. Support for unlimited classes by trainer (subscription) d. Schedule/Calendar/Availability management i. Ties in with Class creation, ability to see available times, set class times, durations, and calendar ii. Support for cancelation e. Support for rescheduling f. Student Account and dashboard i. Account management Manage payment information See order history ii. Upcoming classes iii. Ability to join an upcoming class iv. Subscription management Ability to cancel/modify their subscriptions g. Admin Dashboard i. Ability to see statistics ii. Ability to see active users iii. Ability to see active classes iv. Ability to join classes in a hidden mode (moderator style) v. Ability to manage teachers Onboard, cancel, message vi. Ability to manage system email templates 4. Payment Integration i. Checkout functionality for a user to purchase 5. Notification System i. Email (integration with SendGrid type of tool) ii. SMS (integration with Twilio type of tool) iii. Transactional messaging for all user actions and class status iv. Tokenized emails for joining a scheduled class v. Reminders vi. Ability to manage system settings 6. Testing and Deployment a. Internal Testing and QA b. UAT phase, testing with client 7. Code & Documentation a. Code Delivery to clients repo i. If Customer does not have a code repository, Assemble will assist in creating such on the Customer's behalf b. Deliver documentation to Customer upon project completion i. Includes technical spec documentation outlines technical details such as programming language, frameworks, libraries used, etc
Includes user guide that outlines how the application works. This is structured via screenshots and explanations of the various features and functions

Job.Name: Google Tag Manager - Domain Expert
Job.Description:
The clients Marketing and PR Firm (Havas) helped with an analytics audit of the Phathom Pharma website (attached as PPT) as they prepare for the launch of some marketing campaigns and more overall detailed analytics reporting.
Also attached is the measurement plan (toolkit) including the GTM containers for Google Analytics. Havas is happy to setup a call with you or your tech/analytics team(s) to walk through the document and ensure the measurements are updated as needed.
Please find the audit synopsis below including solutions:
Issues 1-8:
Premium CTA tracking Navigation Menu Tracking Search Tracking About page CTA tracking Our Science CTA tracking Publication essential tracking IR page missing GA tracking
Solution: The above issues will need to be addressed by 3Media and Intrado (Manages IR site).
Issues 9-10:
Demographics reporting GA goals configured
Solution: We will share GTM and Google Analytics accounts with you. You will need to implement deploy codes and the datalayer codes one time only, and then we can handle updates such as these on our end.

Job.Name: B2B Consultant with Sales Experience
Job.Description:
I have a growth agency serving 40 early stage companies with a focus on Cold Email Outbound.
For my clients I need: - consultants with B2B sales expertise who can help my clients with their outbound growth challenges
He has a hard time finding people who can speak to b2b growth and understand how to parse it.
His team helps them segment the market and segment the emails, etc. The consultant is looking at the dashboard and goes "are we winning are we losing, and communicates with the person. You continue adding on people.
B2B email marketers who have an understanding of cold emails would work. Media buyers who can suss out whether it's winning or losing would work.

We are in need of a webmaster who can help us with a variety of different website issues. This will mainly be for up-keep as time goes on and the company grows, only needing about 5 hours a week.
Tasks will include fixing broken links, making sure pictures are showing up, that links to challenges are working, and going over old articles to update SEO to better rank on Google.
For this role we are seeking more of an expert and strategist who can make suggestions as well as do the work. Someone who can grow with the company but also has 3-5 years of experience. Someone with food-blogging is a plus.

Hours are estimated by Task and totaled for the Project Actual hours will be tracked, and reported on a regular cadence Actual hours will be billed on a regular cadence (typically every 2 weeks) Hours per Task and Project may be adjusted with approval/ notice NOTE: Some work may be completed by talent on set contracts (not hourly) Duration may be extended or shortened and total hours adjusted with approval/notice

Task.Name: 20501 Project Management
Task.Description: Plan, Track Budget, Manage Resources

Task.Name: 20501 Development + Testing
Task.Description:
Build/Code and test an MVP of the Fitness App Utilizing the MVP Product Requirements Document as a guide, the following deliverables will be included in Development and Deployment: 1. RTC Real-time Communication a. Integration with RTC provider to provide connections between multiple parties b. Support for 1 to 1 and 1 to many sessions c. Support for mobile devices i. Student will be able to join a session from their phone or tablet d. Provider: Twilio Video or similar e. Session limitations (duration, qty) 2. Music Provider Integration a. Requires additional research for source integration. b. Allow Trainer to toggle music stream 3. Web App a. Public Trainer Profiles i. Unique Marketable URL ii. Sharable Actions iii. Visitor tracking iv. Displays Classes v. Displays Calendar View vi. User can Select Class to see Class Details b. Trainer Dashboard i. Ability to create classes ii. See stats iii. See upcoming classes iv. Start a class v. Ability to integrate limited email marketing/sending (to be defined) vi. Ability to push class details/marketing posts to Social (to be defined) vii. Ability to select a charity partner from an integrated dropdown (based on Pledge.io plugin) c. Booking workflow with Class Type Logic i. Class selection ii. Support for one-time class purchase (single purchase) iii. Support for unlimited classes by trainer (subscription) d. Schedule/Calendar/Availability management i. Ties in with Class creation, ability to see available times, set class times, durations, and calendar ii. Support for cancelation e. Support for rescheduling f. Student Account and dashboard i. Account management Manage payment information See order history ii. Upcoming classes iii. Ability to join an upcoming class iv. Subscription management Ability to cancel/modify their subscriptions g. Admin Dashboard i. Ability to see statistics ii. Ability to see active users iii. Ability to see active classes iv. Ability to join classes in a hidden mode (moderator style) v. Ability to manage teachers Onboard, cancel, message vi. Ability to manage system email templates 4. Payment Integration i. Checkout functionality for a user to purchase 5. Notification System i. Email (integration with SendGrid type of tool) ii. SMS (integration with Twilio type of tool) iii. Transactional messaging for all user actions and class status iv. Tokenized emails for joining a scheduled class v. Reminders vi. Ability to manage system settings 6. Testing and Deployment a. Internal Testing and QA b. UAT phase, testing with client 7. Code & Documentation a. Code Delivery to clients repo i. If Customer does not have a code repository, Assemble will assist in creating such on the Customer's behalf b. Deliver documentation to Customer upon project completion i. Includes technical spec documentation outlines technical details such as programming language, frameworks, libraries used, etc
Includes user guide that outlines how the application works. This is structured via screenshots and explanations of the various features and functions

Job.Description:
This talent must be able to take creative direction and run with it.
Marketing Strategist (15-20 hrs/week, 7-10 years experience) helps select and define the strategies & tactics for each client, provides support in proposals, owns data analysis, manages conversion rate optimization, defines customer segmentation & testing framework, selects marketing technologies, and manages budgets across channels.

SEO Marketer (10 hrs/week, 2-3 years experience) manages the search engine optimization campaigns, performs research on the industry/domain, creates backlinks, identifies technical issues hindering SEO performance, and continually measures and monitors SEO performance for clients campaigns and our online domain-specific properties.
This is more of an expert role, needed ASAP. Rate is in the 100 dollar-120 range.

Job.Name: Squarespace Website - Bradley Sinclair Music
Job.Description:
I will be wanting to sell some Merch on the site. I dont have any at the moment but i definitely want the option. It would be like tshirts, vinyls, hats, stuff that you would see at a bands Merch table.
I want it to be pretty simple, a home page, a music page (links to places to listen like Spotify, Apple Music, YouTube etc.) An event page where we can list your dates and shows and what not, a contact section for booking etc. and a store section for Merch. Also some little things like a place to sign up for the mailing list on the main page towards the bottom or something. Id also like the main page to be able to like add new things, so if Im releasing a new song that would be the first thing you see, or if i just out out a music video Id want that to be the main page for a period of time.
On those sites i like that they are simple and get the advertisement point across well. Of the three platforms i probably like the two square space ones best .

Job.Name: Google Tag Manager - Domain Expert
Job.Description:
The clients Marketing and PR Firm (Havas) helped with an analytics audit of the Phathom Pharma website (attached as PPT) as they prepare for the launch of some marketing campaigns and more overall detailed analytics reporting.
Also attached is the measurement plan (toolkit) including the GTM containers for Google Analytics. Havas is happy to setup a call with you or your tech/analytics team(s) to walk through the document and ensure the measurements are updated as needed.
Please find the audit synopsis below including solutions:
Issues 1-8:
Premium CTA tracking Navigation Menu Tracking Search Tracking About page CTA tracking Our Science CTA tracking Publication essential tracking IR page missing GA tracking
Solution: The above issues will need to be addressed by 3Media and Intrado (Manages IR site).
Issues 9-10:
Demographics reporting GA goals configured
Solution: We will share GTM and Google Analytics accounts with you. You will need to implement deploy codes and the datalayer codes one time only, and then we can handle updates such as these on our end.

Job.Name: Marketing Strategist /Paid Social/SEO Manager - Landfall Data
Job.Description:
This talent must be able to take creative direction and run with it.
Marketing Strategist (15-20 hrs/week, 7-10 years experience) helps select and define the strategies & tactics for each client, provides support in proposals, owns data analysis, manages conversion rate optimization, defines customer segmentation & testing framework, selects marketing technologies, and manages budgets across channels.
Paid Social Media Marketer (15 hrs/week, 2-3 years experience) responsible for implementing the paid social advertising strategy across channels such as Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, TikTok, Pinterest, Twitter, and Reddit; select the right channels, creatives, copy, run A/B tests, and monitor and measure improvement.
SEO Marketer (10 hrs/week, 2-3 years experience) manages the search engine optimization campaigns, performs research on the industry/domain, creates backlinks, identifies technical issues hindering SEO performance, and continually measures and monitors SEO performance for clients campaigns and our online domain-specific properties.
This is more of an expert role, needed ASAP. Rate is in the 100 dollar-120 range.

Job.Name: Fitness App FRD + Build
Job.Description:
Creation of detailed Feature and Function Specifications. Development, Deployment and Testing of an MVP of the Fitness App.
Hours are estimated by Task and totaled for the Project Actual hours will be tracked, and reported on a regular cadence Actual hours will be billed on a regular cadence (typically every 2 weeks) Hours per Task and Project may be adjusted with approval/ notice NOTE: Some work may be completed by talent on set contracts (not hourly) Duration may be extended or shortened and total hours adjusted with approval/notice

Task.Name: 20501 Project Management
Task.Description: Plan, Track Budget, Manage Resources

Task.Name: 20501 Development + Testing
Task.Description:
Build/Code and test an MVP of the Fitness App Utilizing the MVP Product Requirements Document as a guide, the following deliverables will be included in Development and Deployment: 1. RTC Real-time Communication a. Integration with RTC provider to provide connections between multiple parties b. Support for 1 to 1 and 1 to many sessions c. Support for mobile devices i. Student will be able to join a session from their phone or tablet d. Provider: Twilio Video or similar e. Session limitations (duration, qty) 2. Music Provider Integration a. Requires additional research for source integration. b. Allow Trainer to toggle music stream 3. Web App a. Public Trainer Profiles i. Unique Marketable URL ii. Sharable Actions iii. Visitor tracking iv. Displays Classes v. Displays Calendar View vi. User can Select Class to see Class Details b. Trainer Dashboard i. Ability to create classes ii. See stats iii. See upcoming classes iv. Start a class v. Ability to integrate limited email marketing/sending (to be defined) vi. Ability to push class details/marketing posts to Social (to be defined) vii. Ability to select a charity partner from an integrated dropdown (based on Pledge.io plugin) c. Booking workflow with Class Type Logic i. Class selection ii. Support for one-time class purchase (single purchase) iii. Support for unlimited classes by trainer (subscription) d. Schedule/Calendar/Availability management i. Ties in with Class creation, ability to see available times, set class times, durations, and calendar ii. Support for cancelation e. Support for rescheduling f. Student Account and dashboard i. Account management Manage payment information See order history ii. Upcoming classes iii. Ability to join an upcoming class iv. Subscription management Ability to cancel/modify their subscriptions g. Admin Dashboard i. Ability to see statistics ii. Ability to see active users iii. Ability to see active classes iv. Ability to join classes in a hidden mode (moderator style) v. Ability to manage teachers Onboard, cancel, message vi. Ability to manage system email templates 4. Payment Integration i. Checkout functionality for a user to purchase 5. Notification System i. Email (integration with SendGrid type of tool) ii. SMS (integration with Twilio type of tool) iii. Transactional messaging for all user actions and class status iv. Tokenized emails for joining a scheduled class v. Reminders vi. Ability to manage system settings 6. Testing and Deployment a. Internal Testing and QA b. UAT phase, testing with client 7. Code & Documentation a. Code Delivery to clients repo i. If Customer does not have a code repository, Assemble will assist in creating such on the Customer's behalf b. Deliver documentation to Customer upon project completion i. Includes technical spec documentation outlines technical details such as programming language, frameworks, libraries used, etc
Includes user guide that outlines how the application works. This is structured via screenshots and explanations of the various features and functions

Job.Name: Marketing Growth Expert
Job.Description:
We are trying to create an exclusive cult brand for our wine company. We need a marketing expert skilled in content creation from existing assets, email list building, email campaigns, social media presence, paid social, etc.
We have the raw materials already, this person would need to just be able to put it together to create that journey. Have a ton of content with winemaker, images, wine critic ratings, etc from the top of the funnel all the way through the end.
We aren't expecting perfection. We can take the iterative approach. Someone who's not 15 years of experience, but is higher than an apprentice to help us grow our list by 3x in the next few months. Start off with 10 hours a week and go down to 5 hours a week after.
Can boost their 500 person email list to 3x in the next few months. Wants to be impressed by the caliber of the work and give them full autonomy.
The sooner the better.

Task.Name: 20501 Development + Testing
Task.Description:
Build/Code and test an MVP of the Fitness App Utilizing the MVP Product Requirements Document as a guide, the following deliverables will be included in Development and Deployment: 1. RTC Real-time Communication a. Integration with RTC provider to provide connections between multiple parties b. Support for 1 to 1 and 1 to many sessions c. Support for mobile devices i. Student will be able to join a session from their phone or tablet d. Provider: Twilio Video or similar e. Session limitations (duration, qty) 2. Music Provider Integration a. Requires additional research for source integration. b. Allow Trainer to toggle music stream 3. Web App a. Public Trainer Profiles i. Unique Marketable URL ii. Sharable Actions iii. Visitor tracking iv. Displays Classes v. Displays Calendar View vi. User can Select Class to see Class Details b. Trainer Dashboard i. Ability to create classes ii. See stats iii. See upcoming classes iv. Start a class v. Ability to integrate limited email marketing/sending (to be defined) vi. Ability to push class details/marketing posts to Social (to be defined) vii. Ability to select a charity partner from an integrated dropdown (based on Pledge.io plugin) c. Booking workflow with Class Type Logic i. Class selection ii. Support for one-time class purchase (single purchase) iii. Support for unlimited classes by trainer (subscription) d. Schedule/Calendar/Availability management i. Ties in with Class creation, ability to see available times, set class times, durations, and calendar ii. Support for cancelation e. Support for rescheduling f. Student Account and dashboard i. Account management Manage payment information See order history ii. Upcoming classes iii. Ability to join an upcoming class iv. Subscription management Ability to cancel/modify their subscriptions g. Admin Dashboard i. Ability to see statistics ii. Ability to see active users iii. Ability to see active classes iv. Ability to join classes in a hidden mode (moderator style) v. Ability to manage teachers Onboard, cancel, message vi. Ability to manage system email templates 4. Payment Integration i. Checkout functionality for a user to purchase 5. Notification System i. Email (integration with SendGrid type of tool) ii. SMS (integration with Twilio type of tool) iii. Transactional messaging for all user actions and class status iv. Tokenized emails for joining a scheduled class v. Reminders vi. Ability to manage system settings 6. Testing and Deployment a. Internal Testing and QA b. UAT phase, testing with client 7. Code & Documentation a. Code Delivery to clients repo i. If Customer does not have a code repository, Assemble will assist in creating such on the Customer's behalf b. Deliver documentation to Customer upon project completion i. Includes technical spec documentation outlines technical details such as programming language, frameworks, libraries used, etc
Includes user guide that outlines how the application works. This is structured via screenshots and explanations of the various features and functions

Hours are estimated by Task and totaled for the Project Actual hours will be tracked, and reported on a regular cadence Actual hours will be billed on a regular cadence (typically every 2 weeks) Hours per Task and Project may be adjusted with approval/ notice NOTE: Some work may be completed by talent on set contracts (not hourly) Duration may be extended or shortened and total hours adjusted with approval/notice

Task.Name: 20501 Project Management
Task.Description: Plan, Track Budget, Manage Resources

Task.Name: 20501 Development + Testing
Task.Description:
Build/Code and test an MVP of the Fitness App Utilizing the MVP Product Requirements Document as a guide, the following deliverables will be included in Development and Deployment: 1. RTC Real-time Communication a. Integration with RTC provider to provide connections between multiple parties b. Support for 1 to 1 and 1 to many sessions c. Support for mobile devices i. Student will be able to join a session from their phone or tablet d. Provider: Twilio Video or similar e. Session limitations (duration, qty) 2. Music Provider Integration a. Requires additional research for source integration. b. Allow Trainer to toggle music stream 3. Web App a. Public Trainer Profiles i. Unique Marketable URL ii. Sharable Actions iii. Visitor tracking iv. Displays Classes v. Displays Calendar View vi. User can Select Class to see Class Details b. Trainer Dashboard i. Ability to create classes ii. See stats iii. See upcoming classes iv. Start a class v. Ability to integrate limited email marketing/sending (to be defined) vi. Ability to push class details/marketing posts to Social (to be defined) vii. Ability to select a charity partner from an integrated dropdown (based on Pledge.io plugin) c. Booking workflow with Class Type Logic i. Class selection ii. Support for one-time class purchase (single purchase) iii. Support for unlimited classes by trainer (subscription) d. Schedule/Calendar/Availability management i. Ties in with Class creation, ability to see available times, set class times, durations, and calendar ii. Support for cancelation e. Support for rescheduling f. Student Account and dashboard i. Account management Manage payment information See order history ii. Upcoming classes iii. Ability to join an upcoming class iv. Subscription management Ability to cancel/modify their subscriptions g. Admin Dashboard i. Ability to see statistics ii. Ability to see active users iii. Ability to see active classes iv. Ability to join classes in a hidden mode (moderator style) v. Ability to manage teachers Onboard, cancel, message vi. Ability to manage system email templates 4. Payment Integration i. Checkout functionality for a user to purchase 5. Notification System i. Email (integration with SendGrid type of tool) ii. SMS (integration with Twilio type of tool) iii. Transactional messaging for all user actions and class status iv. Tokenized emails for joining a scheduled class v. Reminders vi. Ability to manage system settings 6. Testing and Deployment a. Internal Testing and QA b. UAT phase, testing with client 7. Code & Documentation a. Code Delivery to clients repo i. If Customer does not have a code repository, Assemble will assist in creating such on the Customer's behalf b. Deliver documentation to Customer upon project completion i. Includes technical spec documentation outlines technical details such as programming language, frameworks, libraries used, etc
Includes user guide that outlines how the application works. This is structured via screenshots and explanations of the various features and functions

Task.Name: 20501 Development + Testing
Task.Description:
Build/Code and test an MVP of the Fitness App Utilizing the MVP Product Requirements Document as a guide, the following deliverables will be included in Development and Deployment: 1. RTC Real-time Communication a. Integration with RTC provider to provide connections between multiple parties b. Support for 1 to 1 and 1 to many sessions c. Support for mobile devices i. Student will be able to join a session from their phone or tablet d. Provider: Twilio Video or similar e. Session limitations (duration, qty) 2. Music Provider Integration a. Requires additional research for source integration. b. Allow Trainer to toggle music stream 3. Web App a. Public Trainer Profiles i. Unique Marketable URL ii. Sharable Actions iii. Visitor tracking iv. Displays Classes v. Displays Calendar View vi. User can Select Class to see Class Details b. Trainer Dashboard i. Ability to create classes ii. See stats iii. See upcoming classes iv. Start a class v. Ability to integrate limited email marketing/sending (to be defined) vi. Ability to push class details/marketing posts to Social (to be defined) vii. Ability to select a charity partner from an integrated dropdown (based on Pledge.io plugin) c. Booking workflow with Class Type Logic i. Class selection ii. Support for one-time class purchase (single purchase) iii. Support for unlimited classes by trainer (subscription) d. Schedule/Calendar/Availability management i. Ties in with Class creation, ability to see available times, set class times, durations, and calendar ii. Support for cancelation e. Support for rescheduling f. Student Account and dashboard i. Account management Manage payment information See order history ii. Upcoming classes iii. Ability to join an upcoming class iv. Subscription management Ability to cancel/modify their subscriptions g. Admin Dashboard i. Ability to see statistics ii. Ability to see active users iii. Ability to see active classes iv. Ability to join classes in a hidden mode (moderator style) v. Ability to manage teachers Onboard, cancel, message vi. Ability to manage system email templates 4. Payment Integration i. Checkout functionality for a user to purchase 5. Notification System i. Email (integration with SendGrid type of tool) ii. SMS (integration with Twilio type of tool) iii. Transactional messaging for all user actions and class status iv. Tokenized emails for joining a scheduled class v. Reminders vi. Ability to manage system settings 6. Testing and Deployment a. Internal Testing and QA b. UAT phase, testing with client 7. Code & Documentation a. Code Delivery to clients repo i. If Customer does not have a code repository, Assemble will assist in creating such on the Customer's behalf b. Deliver documentation to Customer upon project completion i. Includes technical spec documentation outlines technical details such as programming language, frameworks, libraries used, etc

Job.Name: Fitness App FRD + Build
Job.Description:
Creation of detailed Feature and Function Specifications. Development, Deployment and Testing of an MVP of the Fitness App.
Hours are estimated by Task and totaled for the Project Actual hours will be tracked, and reported on a regular cadence Actual hours will be billed on a regular cadence (typically every 2 weeks) Hours per Task and Project may be adjusted with approval/ notice NOTE: Some work may be completed by talent on set contracts (not hourly) Duration may be extended or shortened and total hours adjusted with approval/notice

Task.Name: 20501 Project Management
Task.Description: Plan, Track Budget, Manage Resources

Task.Name: 20501 Development + Testing
Task.Description:
Build/Code and test an MVP of the Fitness App Utilizing the MVP Product Requirements Document as a guide, the following deliverables will be included in Development and Deployment: 1. RTC Real-time Communication a. Integration with RTC provider to provide connections between multiple parties b. Support for 1 to 1 and 1 to many sessions c. Support for mobile devices i. Student will be able to join a session from their phone or tablet d. Provider: Twilio Video or similar e. Session limitations (duration, qty) 2. Music Provider Integration a. Requires additional research for source integration. b. Allow Trainer to toggle music stream 3. Web App a. Public Trainer Profiles i. Unique Marketable URL ii. Sharable Actions iii. Visitor tracking iv. Displays Classes v. Displays Calendar View vi. User can Select Class to see Class Details b. Trainer Dashboard i. Ability to create classes ii. See stats iii. See upcoming classes iv. Start a class v. Ability to integrate limited email marketing/sending (to be defined) vi. Ability to push class details/marketing posts to Social (to be defined) vii. Ability to select a charity partner from an integrated dropdown (based on Pledge.io plugin) c. Booking workflow with Class Type Logic i. Class selection ii. Support for one-time class purchase (single purchase) iii. Support for unlimited classes by trainer (subscription) d. Schedule/Calendar/Availability management i. Ties in with Class creation, ability to see available times, set class times, durations, and calendar ii. Support for cancelation e. Support for rescheduling f. Student Account and dashboard i. Account management Manage payment information See order history ii. Upcoming classes iii. Ability to join an upcoming class iv. Subscription management Ability to cancel/modify their subscriptions g. Admin Dashboard i. Ability to see statistics ii. Ability to see active users iii. Ability to see active classes iv. Ability to join classes in a hidden mode (moderator style) v. Ability to manage teachers Onboard, cancel, message vi. Ability to manage system email templates 4. Payment Integration i. Checkout functionality for a user to purchase 5. Notification System i. Email (integration with SendGrid type of tool) ii. SMS (integration with Twilio type of tool) iii. Transactional messaging for all user actions and class status iv. Tokenized emails for joining a scheduled class v. Reminders vi. Ability to manage system settings 6. Testing and Deployment a. Internal Testing and QA b. UAT phase, testing with client 7. Code & Documentation a. Code Delivery to clients repo i. If Customer does not have a code repository, Assemble will assist in creating such on the Customer's behalf b. Deliver documentation to Customer upon project completion i. Includes technical spec documentation outlines technical details such as programming language, frameworks, libraries used, etc
Includes user guide that outlines how the application works. This is structured via screenshots and explanations of the various features and functions
